title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 225-2.8 - Existing air contamination sources

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 225-2.8 - Existing air contamination sources

State Regulations

Any person who, on the effective date of this Subpart, owns or operates an existing air contamination source in which waste fuel is
being burned must either: (a) possess a
valid certificate to operate meeting the requirements of section
225-2.5
(a) of this

Subpart; or
(b) within 180 days of
the effective date of this Subpart, submit a complete application for an
amended certificate to operate for burning waste fuel. If a certificate to
operate is denied, the owner and/or operator must discontinue burning waste
fuel within 45 days of receipt of the denial. Notes
